node.title: Rittenhouse and the Right’s White Vigilante Heroes
node.description: The great threat is that there are young men out there who watched the verdict and now want to follow Rittenhouse’s lead.

node.title: Oklahoma Lawmaker Who Supports Death Penalty Laments Its Possible End in His State
node.description: Oklahoma has had a series of bungled legal injections, such as John Marion Grant's execution on Oct. 28. He was given Midazolam which caused him to convulse.

node.title: Senate Unanimously Confirms First Native American Leader of National Park Service
node.description: Charles Sams III was confirmed by unanimous vote in the Senate Thursday, the first confirmed director of the National Park Service since 2017.

node.title: 'Buy Firearms and Form Christian Militias': Far Right Reacts to Rittenhouse Verdict
node.description: One extremism expert has warned that the Rittenhouse verdict will give a "blank check" for extremists to commit political violence.

node.title: Investigation Into Former Gov. Cuomo Shows He Misrepresented Nursing Home COVID Deaths
node.description: Former Gov. Andrew Cuomo's administration decided to exclude the deaths of patients transferred to hospitals from its overall death tolls for nursing homes.

node.title: Two wounded as Dutch police fire shots at protest over new Covid restrictions
node.description: Crowds of rioters in Rotterdam torched cars and threw rocks at police who responded with shots and water cannons, as protests against Covid-19 measures turned violent.

node.title: Motorists warned to avoid Kawarau Gorge during night time roadworks
node.description: Motorists should prepare for a lengthy detour or avoid travel when State Highway 6 near Queenstown is closed overnight from Sunday evening.

node.title: Foodstuffs mistakenly releases contaminated sugar
node.description: Foodstuffs is recalling some raw sugar which was subject to a recall earlier this month due to lead contamination, but released in error.

node.title: Austria to go into full lockdown as Covid-19 surges
node.description: Days after Austria imposed a lockdown on the unvaccinated, it has announced a full national Covid-19 lockdown starting on Monday.

node.title: The Australian Open will require players to be fully vaccinated.
node.description: The rule casts doubt on the participation of Novak Djokovic and others.

node.title: Fact-Checking Kevin McCarthy’s 8-Hour Speech
node.description: The House Republican leader made a number of false or misleading claims about the social spending bill, President Biden, immigration policy and Teslas.

node.title: Forest Service Allows Drilling to Resume in Exploration of Yellowstone Goldmine
node.description: After a new environmental plan was designed to reduce impact to a local species of trout, the U.S. Forest Service allowed resumption of gold mining in Idaho.

node.title: Dunedin on track to keep trains running
node.description: The future of Dunedin railway services - including the Taieri Gorge line to Hindon - could be secured until mid-2024.

node.title: 3 Officers Used Excessive Force in Arrest of Black Teen, U.S. Says
node.description: The officers were charged with violating the teenager’s civil rights when they stomped on his head in New Jersey in 2018.

node.title: Body of a Most Wanted US Fugitive Discovered Four Months After He Died of Natural Causes
node.description: Frederick McLean had been on the U.S. Marshals 15 Most Wanted list for 15 years for the sexual assault of at least eight young girls before being found dead.

node.title: 13 Siblings Rescued From Prison Conditions at Home 3 Years Ago Feel 'Betrayed' By System
node.description: There were instances where there was neither a safe place for the children nor food while receiving social services.

node.title: Butterfield Will Not Run for a 10th Term in Congress; Blames Gerrymandering
node.description: "The map that was recently enacted by the legislature is a partisan map. It is racially gerrymandered," Butterfield said in the video announcing his retirement.

node.title: No two-legged intercontinental playoffs for last places at Qatar World Cup
node.description: If Australia has to go in the intercontinental playoffs for the World Cup finals in Qatar, they won't be able to clinch a spot in front of home fans or a hostile away crowd, with FIFA saying playoffs will be one-off games at neutral venues.

node.title: Queensland records zero locally acquired COVID cases
node.description: Queensland records zero locally acquired COVID-19 cases as the state inches close to its 80 per cent double dose milestone.

node.title: Photographer Mick Rock, known as 'the man who shot the 70s', dies aged 72
node.description: The UK rock photographer, who took iconic images of Lou Reed, Iggy Pop and Queen as well as being David Bowie's official photographer in the early 1970s, is remembered as a "photographic poet".

node.title: Rittenhouse verdict pours fuel on America’s heated gun debate
node.description: Kyle Rittenhouse‘s acquittal for the fatal shootings of racial justice protesters last year spurs strong opinions on both sides of the US gun debate.

node.title: Thousands of protesters march through Melbourne as anti-lockdown, vaccine mandate rallies begin
node.description: Crowds voicing anti-lockdown and anti-vaccine mandate messages have taken to the streets in Melbourne, Sydney and others parts of the country.

node.title: Northern Territory records one new COVID-19 case
node.description: The Chief Minister says the Northern Territory recorded one new case of coronavirus.

node.title: Lukashenko tells BBC: We may have helped migrants into EU
node.description: Belarus's authoritarian leader has told the BBC it is "absolutely possible" his forces helped migrants cross into Poland but denies they were invited.

node.title: This week on "Face the Nation," November 21, 2021
node.description: Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand and more appear on Sunday's "Face the Nation."

node.title: Elizabeth Holmes takes the stand in her criminal fraud trial
node.description: The decision to have Holmes testify so early in her defense was a bombshell development with considerable risk.

node.title: Watch Dwayne Johnson Chase Ryan Reynolds in ‘Red Notice’
node.description: The director Rawson Marshall Thurber narrates a sequence set in a museum.

node.title: Concern and Anger Build Over Missing Athlete’s Sexual Assault Allegations
node.description: The case of Peng Shuai has prompted the women’s tennis tour to rethink its heavy focus in China, where it has threatened to pull events if it cannot verify that she is safe and that her allegations are investigated.

node.title: Scams and Slippery Slopes
node.description: Swindling has become a respectable institution in America. How?

node.title: When it comes to self-defense, the burden is often on the prosecution.
node.description: The acquittal of Kyle Rittenhouse points to the wide berth given to defendants who say they acted out of fear.
